avdta.network.link.cell

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.link.cell.Cell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Cell>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DLRCell, LinkCell, SharedTransitCell, StartCell

    public abstract class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Cell>
    This class represents a cell in the cell transmission model of a link (CTMLink). It stores Vehicles currently in the cell, and determines sending and receiving flows. This class is abstract; see LinkCell. Cells at the start and ends of links are slightly different; see StartCell and EndCell

      • getNumLanes

        public int getNumLanes()
        Returns the number of lanes this Cell has. Note that this can change over time in dynamic lane reversal or dynamic transit lanes.
        Returns:
        the number of lanes

        the link this Cell is part of

      • isCongested

        public boolean isCongested()
        This method estimates whether this Cell for the BackPressureObj. This returns true if the occupancy exceeds the capacity.
        Returns:
        whether this Cell is congested

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the occupancies of this Cell. This is called to restart simulation.

      • getOccupants

        public java.util.List<Vehicle> getOccupants()

        Returns:
        a List containing the Vehicles occupying this Cell

      • getOccupancy

        public int getOccupancy()
        Returns the number of Vehicles occupying this Cell.
        Returns:
        the number of Vehicles occupying this Cell

      • getLength

        public double getLength()
        Returns the length associated with this cell.
        Returns:
        CTMLink.getCellLength()

      • step

        public abstract void step()
        Executes one time step of simulation.

      • addVehicle

        public void addVehicle(Vehicle v)
        Add a Vehicle to this Cell for the next time step. The Vehicle will not be part of this Cell in the current time step.
        Parameters:
        v - the Vehicle to be added.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates this Cell to the next time step. Vehicles that were added will become part of the Cell occupancy.

      • prepare

        public void prepare()
        Initialization work done every time step to prepare this Cell for calculating transition flows.

      • getCapacity

        public double getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of this Cell. The capacity depends on the current number of lanes.
        Returns:
        Link.getCapacityPerLane()*getNumLanes()

      • getJamD

        public double getJamD()
        Returns the jam density of this Cell. The jam density depends on the current number of lanes.
        Returns:
        CTMLink.getCellJamdPerLane()*getNumLanes()

      • getAvgReactionTime

        public double getAvgReactionTime()
        Calculates the average reaction time of Vehicles currently in this Cell. This is used to determine the capacity and congested wave speed.
        Returns:
        average reaction time

      • scaleCapacity

        public double scaleCapacity(double c)
        Calculates the scaled capacity based on the reaction time model
        Parameters:
        c - the input capacity
        Returns:
        the scaled capacity

      • scaleWaveSpeed

        public double scaleWaveSpeed(double w)
        Calculates the scaled congested wave speed based on the reaction time model
        Parameters:
        w - the input congested wave speed
        Returns:
        the scaled congested wave speed

      • getNumSendingFlow

        public int getNumSendingFlow()
        Returns the size of the sending flow set of Vehicles
        Returns:
        the size of the sending flow set of Vehicles

      • getSendingFlow

        public java.util.List<Vehicle> getSendingFlow()
        Calculates the set of Vehicles that could exit the cell this time step
        Returns:
        sending flow as set of Vehicles

      • getReceivingFlow

        public double getReceivingFlow()
        Returns the receiving flow for this time step. Note that this changes between time steps because the fractional part of the capacity is saved.
        Returns:
        the receiving flow for this time step

      • getReceivingFlow

        public double getReceivingFlow(int numLanes)
        Calculates the receiving flow for the given number of lanes. This is based on the scaled capacity and congested wave speed.
        Parameters:
        numLanes - the number of lanes available
        Returns:
        the resulting receiving flow

      • removeVehicle

        public boolean removeVehicle(Vehicle v)
        Removes a Vehicle from this Cell
        Parameters:
        v - the Vehicle to be removed
        Returns:
        if the Vehicle was on the Cell

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Estimates the speed for vehicles on this cell as flow/density
        Returns:
        getReceivingFlow()/getOccupancy(), or Link.getFFSpeed() if empty
